metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5296 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Samba 3.x and 4.x before 4.1.22, 4.2.x before 4.2.7, and 4.3.x before 4.3.3 supports connections that are encrypted but unsigned, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to conduct encrypted-to-unencrypted downgrade attacks by modifying the client-server data stream, related to clidfs.c, libsmb_server.c, and smbXcli_base.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5296` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
python-samba - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> 3.2.0 to 4.3.2 3.6 patch in upstream bug

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.3+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
